questions.question: The Louvre is the most visited museum in the world.
The Eiffel Tower was originally designed as a temporary structure.

Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris was completed in the 14th century.
Champagne can only be called 'champagne' if it is produced in the Champagne region.
Mont-Saint-Michel is a mountain located in the south of France.
Disneyland Paris is the largest Disneyland in the world.
France produces more than 300 varieties of cheese.
The French Riviera is also known as the Côte d'Azur.
The city of Lyon is famous for its culinary tradition.
Cannes is known for its music festivals.
Marseille is the largest port in France.
Toulouse is known as the 'Pink City' because of the color of its buildings.
France shares its borders with nine countries.
The Loire is the longest river in France.
Grasse is the world capital of perfume.
The Château de Chenonceau is located in the Seine Valley.
France is the third largest country in Europe by area.
The croissant is a traditional French pastry that was invented in Vienna.
The Château de Versailles is famous for its gardens and palace.
